p: Honokiol is a lignan biphenol derived from the shikimic acid pathway. This compound can be obtained from the Magnolia Tree and is regularly used for the relief of anxiety and as analgesic in Korean, Chinese and Japanese traditional medicine [ 195]. This compound has shown anti-inflammatory [ 196], antithrombotic [ 197], and antioxidant activities that could be used in dermatological [ 198], cardiac [ 199] and neurological disorders [ 200]. Honokiol also induced apoptosis and reduced the proliferation index in implanted human prostate cancer cell (PC-3) tumors in mice [ 201] and had antitumoral effects against angiosarcoma implanted in mice in vivo and as an angiogenesis inhibitor in vitro [ 202, 203]. Its antimicrobial activities include reported antibacterial effects against methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) [ 204] and as an antiviral inhibitor of HSV-1 DNA replication and virus production [ 205] and HCV entry, replication and protein translation (SI: 5.4) [ 206].
